BasicDescription.Title: Gardeners' Question Time
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Eric Robson chairs the popular horticultural forum. Bob Flowerdew, Pippa Greenwood and Roy Lancaster answer questions sent in by post.

BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Peacemakers: By Margaret MacMillan. President Woodrow Wilson Comes To Europe. For the first six months of 1919 Paris effectively became the capital of the world. .

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: It's chaos at the Home Farm Shoot.

BasicDescription.Title: Case Notes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Graham Easton talks to migraine sufferers and investigates the latest treatments for this debilitating condition.

BasicDescription.Title: Midnight News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Shipping Forecast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: As BBC World Service
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes. BBC Radio 4 resumes at 5.35am.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio 4 Open Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Includes a News Summary, the latest Shipping and Inshore Waters forecasts, and Prayer For The Day.

BasicDescription.Title: Farming Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Agricultural news and features with Miriam O'Reilly.

BasicDescription.Title: Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With John Humphrys and James Naughtie. Includes Sports Desk at 6.25am, 7.25am and 8.25am; Weather at 6.55am and 7.55am; Thought For The Day at 7.45am. Yesterday In Parliament at 6.45am.

BasicDescription.Title: Midweek
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Libby Purves and guests engage in lively and diverse conversation.

BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Peacemakers: By Margaret MacMillan. Part 3: Georges Clemenceau and David Lloyd George. .

Peacemakers: By Margaret MacMillan. At the end of the First World War the leaders of the world met in Paris to try and forge a lasting peace. Part 3: Georges Clemenceau and David Lloyd George. Read by Jane Lapotaire.

BasicDescription.Title: Woman's Hour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Jenni Murray. Includes at 10.45am the drama Mary Hays In Love. Adapted for radio and introduced by Philippa Gregory.

With Jenni Murray. Includes at 10.45am the drama Mary Hays In Love. Adapted for radio and introduced by Philippa Gregory.
Part Three
In spite of family objections to their relationship, Mary and John continue to write secretly to one another. They even dare to plan a meeting.
Mary Hays ...... Poppy Miller John Eccles ...... Nick Fletcher

BasicDescription.Title: A Class Act
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Series following the fortunes of a secondary school, set up to replace a failing school. This edition looks at how the school deals with children with special needs.

A series charting a brave experiment in secondary education, the launch of a new school on the site of what was one of the country's most notorious comprehensives. This week we hear how the school deals with the large number of children with special needs seeking places and the additional support they need to help them in the classroom.

BasicDescription.Title: The Matchmaker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Written by the late John B. Keane, award winning play The Matchmaker is a collection of dramatised letters between a matchmaker in rural Ireland and his lonely-hearted clients.

Written by the late John B Keane, The Matchmaker is a collection of dramatised letters, resonant with wit, mischief, pain and pathos, between a matchmaker in rural Ireland and his lonely-hearted clients.
Recorded at the Siamsa Tire Theatre in Tralee, Ireland, an all star cast perform this timeless and hilarious 3 part series Tony Award winner Anna Manahan, Des Keogh, Niall Toibin [Ballykissangel], Pauline McLynn [Father Ted], David Kelly [Waking Ned] and Jeananne Crowley [Educating Rita].
In Episode 2, Dickie continues to try and bring happiness to his lonely neighbours but sometimes they just don't appreciate his efforts. Claude Glynn Hunter finally finds himself a suitable match, although Fionulla Crust remains unsatisfied. And this time she is determined to get her revenge on Dickie, with disastrous consequences.

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news headlines from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: You And Yours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Consumer news and discussion with Liz Barclay and John Waite.

BasicDescription.Title: The World At One
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news from BBC Radio 4. With reports from our correspondents worldwide. Presented by Nick Clarke.

BasicDescription.Title: Wireless Wise
BasicDescription.Synopsis: David Hatch chairs the radio quiz about radio. This week Barry Cryer and Sue MacGregor challenge Donna McPhail and John Waite.

David Hatch chairs the radio quiz about radio. This week Barry Cryer and Sue MacGregor challenge Donna McPhail and John Waite. Questions involve disasters in the Brownies and electronic flatulence on the Today programme.

BasicDescription.Title: Afternoon Play
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Paper Flowers: By Aisha Khan. Pakistan 1949 and Zair returns to Lahore from his long stay in England with his new fianc� Jane.

Paper Flowers: By Aisha Khan.
Pakistan 1949. Zair returns to Lahore from his long stay in England, with his new fianc�, Jane. But as the preparations for the wedding get underway and the tension mounts between Jane and Zair's first wife Taj, will Zair be forced to make a difficult choice?
Zair ...... Rez Kempton Taj ...... Archie Panjabi Jane ...... Emma Cunniffe Barkhat ...... Sanjit Sil Fazal ...... Bhasker Patel Anise ...... Parminder Sekhon Rehan ...... Shakeel Ahmed Azam ...... Kameron Shah

BasicDescription.Title: The City
BasicDescription.Synopsis: 9th And 13th: By Jonathan Coe. A New York pianist meets a stranger and dreams of what might be.

BasicDescription.Title: Herbs: Pure And Simple
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Borage Family: Herb farmer Jekka McVicar travels to Cressing Templer in Essex to meet Roger Tabor naturalist, botanist, author and chairman of the herb society.

The Borage Family
Herb farmer Jekka McVicar travels to Cressing Templer in Essex to meet Roger Tabor naturalist, botanist, author and chairman of the herb society. Together they find out about comfrey, lungwort and borage itself.

BasicDescription.Title: Thinking Allowed
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Shanghai has been described as the future of cities and this week on Thinking Allowed we'll be finding out why when Laurie Taylor talks to Doug Guthrie, author of Dragon In A Three-Piece Suit.

Shanghai has been described as the future of cities and this week on Thinking Allowed we'll be finding out why when Laurie Taylor talks to Doug Guthrie, author of Dragon In A Three-Piece Suit about the quiet revolution transforming business and pleasure in China.

BasicDescription.Title: PM
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news, plus the sports headlines. Presented by Clare English and Eddie Mair.

BasicDescription.Title: Six O'Clock News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Meet Mr Mulliner
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Smile That Wins: By PG Wodehouse. In the bar parlour of the Angler's Rest, the regulars are drawn into another of Mr Mulliner's peculiar tales.

The Smile That Wins: By PG Wodehouse, dramatised by Roger Davenport.
In the bar parlour of the Angler's Rest, the regulars are drawn into another of Mr Mulliner's peculiar tales. When a dyspeptic detective member of the Mulliner family receives a doctor's prescription to smile, the frightening knowingness of his grin spreads terror throughout the titled classes.
Mr Mulliner ...... Richard Griffiths Miss Postlethwaite/Millicent ...... Matilda Ziegler A Port/Specialist/Sir Jasper ...... Peter Acre A Light Ale/Sir Sutton ...... Martin Hyder A Pint of Stout/Lord Brangbolton ...... David Timson A Small Bitter/Adrian ...... Carl Prekopp

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Alice is looking after her big sister.

BasicDescription.Title: Front Row
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Mark Lawson with the arts programme.

BasicDescription.Title: Mary Hays In Love
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Part Three: In spite of family objections to their relationship, Mary and John continue to write secretly to one another. They even dare to plan a meeting.

Adapted for radio and introduced by Philippa Gregory.
Part Three
In spite of family objections to their relationship, Mary and John continue to write secretly to one another. They even dare to plan a meeting.
Mary Hays ...... Poppy Miller John Eccles ...... Nick Fletcher

BasicDescription.Title: The Moral Maze
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Michael Buerk chairs an investigation of the moral questions behind the week's news. With Claire Fox, Ian Hargreaves, Michael Gove and Melanie Phillips.

Michael Buerk chairs a live debate on the moral conundrums behind one of the week's news stories. Claire Fox, Ian Hargreaves, Michael Gove and Melanie Phillips cross-examine witnesses who hold passionate but conflicting views.

BasicDescription.Title: The Voice Of Destiny
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Churchill's Language: Professor David Cannadine assesses Churchill's talent as an orator and reveals how the young politician struggled to master his art.

BasicDescription.Title: The Serendipity Of Science
BasicDescription.Synopsis: From Venom To Viagra: Simon Singh uncovers tales of chance in modern medicine, from an anaesthetic found in greenhouses, antibiotics from frogskin, and the development of that little blue pill.

Taking a look at the lucky accidents behind a surprising number of scientific breakthroughs.
Part 3, From Venom To Viagra
Simon Singh uncovers tales of chance in modern medicine, from an anaesthetic found in greenhouses to antibiotics from frogskin, and the development of that famous little blue pill.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Tonight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the day's national and international stories, including interviews with politicians and public figures.

BasicDescription.Title: Book At Bedtime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tiger In The Smoke: By Margery Allingham. Albert Campion and Luke set out to foil the tiger's plans. Read by Anton Lesser.

BasicDescription.Title: The Best A Man Can Get
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Continuing comedy drama, starring Mark Heap as Michael, a new Dad who escapes from the exhausting misery of babies by leading a secret double life. Adapted from John O'Farrell's best selling novel.

BasicDescription.Title: Today In Parliament
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A review of the day's events in Parliament.
